summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 27, 2019. It details routine prison operations, counts, and security checks, with specific notes that inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was on psychological observation and later suicide watch, accompanied by an inmate companion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate referenced throughout the log by his registration number #76318-054. He is noted as being on psychological observation and later placed on suicide watch, accompanied by an inmate companion.

events.title: Epstein placed on psychological observation and suicide watch
events.description: The prison log notes that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning and day shifts. By the evening shift, he was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Fire safety systems inoperable at MCC
events.description: The log repeatedly notes that the fire alarm and sprinkler/pump systems were non-operational, requiring a fire watch to be in progress throughout the day.

events.title: Routine institutional counts and security checks
events.description: Standard prison operations including multiple inmate counts, body alarm tests, metal detector checks, and roof checks were conducted throughout the three shifts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was documented as being on psychological observation and later suicide watch on July 27, 2019, while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein was accompanied by an inmate companion while on psychological observation and suicide watch.
Critical fire safety systems (fire alarm and sprinkler/pump systems) were inoperable at the facility, requiring a manual fire watch.
The log documents Epstein being at a 'Goldcrest nursing facility' and 'Brooklyn Hospital' under USMS guard escort on this date.
This log is from the day Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (July 27-28, 2019), providing a detailed account of his status and prison conditions hours before his death.
